text: hi everyone i'm alana layton senior
cloud technologist here at aws and i'm
raf lopez also a senior cloud
technologist we're here to tell you
about an exciting new series called
devops on aws this series will be made
up of three courses based on the steps
of a devops process the first three
steps code build and test will be
covered in the first course
the next two steps release and deploy
will be covered in the second course and
then finally our third course of the
series will cover the final steps
operate and monitoring let's go through
each of these courses and talk a bit
about what you should expect ralph what
are some of the topics that will be
covered in the first course in the first
course we will start talking about the
devops culture and then getting to some
of the tools and practices such as
source control and how to successfully
build your code then we will focus on
introducing testing to ensure the code
works we will finish up the course
talking about how to automate this
continuous integration process by
building and testing your code on every
commit it's going to be really fun and
the fun continues in the second course
of the series where we build off of a
lot of the information discussed in the
first course
in the second course the big topics are
continuous delivery and automation
we'll talk about how to automate the
deployment of your code and then how to
automate the provisioning of your
environments as well as the provisioning
of your pipeline by using infrastructure
as code and then we wrap up the series
with the third course operate and
monitor where we talk about the
importance of monitoring and how to
better monitor your application network
and even your cicd pipeline we'll bring
up some tricky infrastructure management
issues that you may run into and talk
about how you can best solve them along
the way there will be quizzes readings
and hands-on exercises to help make sure
you're on the right track please join us
for the devops on aws series and as we
say at amazon work hard have fun make
history see you there
you
